result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin T. Mead was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Justin T. Mead is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Justin T. Mead was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED/STAYED.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Follow through and compliance with Chemical Assessment already completed.
-Attendance of Victim Empathy Seminar.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-NO CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH A.J.W.
-Comply with any other conditions Agent deems appropriate.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 -4.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #22CF31.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #22CF31.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin T. Mead

records.addlTxt: E: DOC. eif
signed by DE & Atty. eif

02:30 PM Defendant Justin T. Mead in Court with Attorneys Jason Bauer and Kirk Anderson.  DA Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA Hatch recites agreement; Defendant pleading to Count One and State is moving to dismiss Counts Two-Four.  3 years in prison; 1 year IC, 2 years ES.  Stayed.  Three years Probation w/conditions of AODA, VES, No contact w/AJW, costs of $518.00.  Atty. Bauer agrees and notes that Defendant has already completed assessment.  DA Hatch agrees that follow through would be an appropriate condition.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the Court; Court reviews with Defendant.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count One.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count One and enters conviction.  Counts Two-Four are dismissed.  DA Hatch states position.  States is in compliance with victim's rights.  Atty. Bauer states position.  Defendant makes statement.  Court questions Defendant.  Court addresses Defendant.   
Court sentences Defendant, Imposed/Stayed.  3 years prison; 1 year 1 day initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP.  
-3 years Probation.  Conditions includes follow through and compliance with chemical assessment already completed, attendance of victim empathy seminar, absolute sobriety, no contact with A.J.W., comply with any other conditions agent deems appropriate.  Court costs of $518.  -DNA sample to be provided.  Two days credit if revoked from Probation.  Court advises of appeal rights.  Defendant to report to Probation today.  Adjourned at 2:51 PM  
(per Judge Rohl - prison sentences must be at least 1 yr 1 day)
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
from Judge Rohl to Atty Anderson's letter "approved for rescheduling; Atty Anderson to initiate contact with JA to reschedule."

Information filed with the Court.  DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Bond remains in its present form. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:42 pm.
filed by DA Halle Hatch. eif

1:35 PM Defendant Justin T. Mead appears in Court, Atty Kirk Anderson, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. . Officer is present. DE wishes to waive. Court questions and reviews DE's rights. Court reviews waiver of PH with DE.  Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH.  The Court finds probable cause a felony was committed and binds DE over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:12 PM Defendant Justin T. Mead appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of AS, NC w/A.J.W., C.D.T.B. or Two Rivers Bar, no objection. Court so orders.  Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:20 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
